headline: Egg Salad Sandwiches
description: Mustard powder, dill weed, garlic powder, and onion flakes are combined in this amazing egg salad. I've always had rave reviews of this great sandwich salad.
name: Egg Salad Sandwiches

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl, gently mix the eggs, mayonnaise, onion flakes, salt, mustard powder, garlic powder, pepper, and dill. Cover, and refrigerate 8 hours, or overnight. To serve, spread equal amounts on 4 slices bread; top with remaining bread slices to make sandwiches.

review.reviewBody: 3.15.22 I’m an egg salad lover, and this is one of the best that I’ve had. I think the two ingredients that differentiate it are the dried onion flakes and the mustard powder rather than basic yellow mustard out of the fridge. Good sandwich, definitely would make again.
This has been my go-to egg salad recipe for a few years now. I always get compliments when others try it. The dill makes all the difference.
SO yummy!
I threw some cut up tomato and some pickles on the top. Great sandwich.
Too much salt, too much dill.
The dried onion is perfect. (Added celery, just because I had it on hand.) Love this recipe!!!
I used real onion and it was very tasty.
I love it so much! It’s yummy, delish, and all of the other synonyms that mean it’s the best egg salad ever.
I only used 1/2 cup mayo. Did not have dill weed so chopped up a dill pickle and used that. Loved the onion flakes in place of real onion. This was creamy, light and delicious.
I added chopped up pickles to the recipe for more flavor and texture. My mom loved it so much she asked ME for the recipe. Usually it’s the other way around!

Awesome Egg Salad!! I love anything with dill in it. It tastes amazing! I did change it to grated fresh onion, like some of the other reviewers suggested. This is definitely a keeper and I will be making it again.

Love this recipe! I always use miracle whip, mustard, celery and paprika which is a good basic recipe. I tried this recipe just as is with real mayonnaise and dry mustard rather than miracle whip and yellow mustard that I’ve always used. The result was a creamier egg salad with no vinegar flavor. I wasn’t sure about using dill weed but it adds a great unexpected layer of flavor. It is a smoother, more blended taste bursting with flavor. This is definitely a step up from my good ole stand by recipe. Thanks for sharing!

Very yummy, definitely need the dill weed. I used 1/2 cup mayo and it was plenty. I also used prepared yellow mustard instead of mustard powder and diced onion instead of onion flakes. Will try adding paprika next time. And some diced bacon.
Tasty, but missing something I couldn't put my finger on.
Different, but pretty good.
Great sandwiches, easy to make.
Best egg salad I have ever made! Am making this again this weekend for daughter and family visit. Made a double amount last time they were here and they all said it was the best... :-)
Delicious! I subbed in onion powder but otherwise followed the recipe to a tee.
I made them for a family gathering with a variety of other snacks and the egg salad sandwiches were one thing we had no left overs of lol, loved it thank you so much for the great recipe.

Made as the recipe stated. I found this terrific recipe years ago here on AllRecipes, and I have been using it whenever I want egg salad sandwiches. I never change anything in the recipe, it stands out just as is.
Great egg salad recipe! I used 1 tsp of onion powder instead of minced or raw onion and added two pieces of chopped cooked bacon and it turned out delicious!
Loved this recipe. I did add onion powder instead of the flakes.
Best ever!
Excellent!! The 1/4 cup onion flakes must be a typo; used 1/4 tsp instead. Add some bacon bits cuz everything is better with bacon!
Came out eggcellent. I omitted the onion as I don't like it. I also used white pepper instead of black. I think the taste is milder. Thanks for the recipe!

There was too much mayo for the amount of eggs. Instead of onion flakes, I used half the amount in onion powder. To make it healthier, I recommend 1/2 cup nonfat plain Greek yogurt plus 1/4-1/2 cup mayo.
Everyone Raves over this recipe! The onion flakes give it a very different flavor over raw onions. I like it b/c it is mostly pantry items.

I have made this twice, now. The first time, I followed the recipe to the letter.The garlic and dill was too much, and I didn't think it melded with the other flavors very well. The second time, I omitted the garlic and dill, and added a half-cup of sweet pickle relish. That's all it took to make it a perfect recipe.

First, I'd like to note that I changed the recipe a bit (maybe more than a bit). It wasn't too salty, but there was two much mayo. People in my house don't like mayo too much, so I ended up added more spices (cayenne pepper, curry powder, and Johnny's seasoning). I also used regular mustard and chopped up onions. If I had done the recipe exactly as it says, I would have ended up with a dish no one would have eaten. Needless to say, my mom and little brother liked it, hence the three stars. I will, however, be going back to my more traditional recipe for egg salad sandwiches, because this recipe just didn't work for me.
I think I would like it better by adding paprika and not using salt. It was still good... just seemed a little too much salt for my taste buds!
Yummy! I used a quarter diced onion instead of onion powder. Next time I would use just a bit less powdered mustard.
Way too salty! - and I am not salt-shy. Followed recipe exactly. Next time, I'll start with half the salt called for.
Good recipe first. I have a question that how many calories for one sandwich?
Very good, used 1/2 cup may, 2T red onions, 1 stalk of Celery, Paprika and Cayenne.
Only thing I did differently was adding 1/2 of a small onion finely diced, didn't have any dried minced onion. Loved the dill weed addition. A keeper for sure!!

Egg Salad is one of those sandwiches that I always forget about, but when I get to making it, I remember how much I love them. This was a great recipe. It was a little heavy on the mayo side, but I'll know to just cut back a smidge next time. Otherwise, delicious!

This definitely had way too much salt, and too much mayonnaise; it drowned out almost all of the egg flavor, and left you with basically a garlic/pickle taste without the crunch. Not a fan. Maybe we were just used to the less-is-more way we remember our moms making it when we were kids; a bit drier (less mayo), and just enough salt so the egg wasn't completely bland, and a bit of black pepper. Maybe she put mustard in there - that part was pretty good in this recipe, and though I'm a fan of dill and certainly garlic, it just didn't play out in this concoction very well. Unless you plan on adding a bunch of smaller items (diced/minced onion, minced garlic, celery, bacon/ham bits, or whatever else) - definitely cut the mayo down and add gradually to taste; that part was a huge factor, I think, in why this didn't work.
Personally, I prefer using a REAL onion. I also like a little crunch in mine so I used some celery that's been cut up.
This is an outstand egg salad, very tasty! I will omit the salt next time. I really don't think it needs it. Well maybe just a pinch....
Too much dill. I preferred using chopped dill pickles.
Next time I will use less onion.
Best egg salad sammy EVER!! I only used 5 eggs, 1/2 C mayo and 2T finely minced onions and full measure of rest of ingredients. LOVE the dill!! Thanks, Sara for sharing. This is my new go to recipe!

This recipe showed up at the perfect time...due to too a surplus of eggs in the fridge. Subbed real onions (green onions, to be exact) and added paprika...I really didn't measure anything, but I definitely didn't use 1 whole cup of mayo...awesome recipe...I love the reviews that give a few added hints. Thanks Sara!!

This is best over steamed Brocolli. The perfect side dish for a holiday dinner. Kids love it & eat their veggies, and adults can't get enought of it. I have served this for years, & it's always a hit!
Pretty good recipe, next time I'll try it with fresh dill. Way too much mayo in my opinion. I only used 3/4 cup and still felt like it was a little too much.
I buttered my white bread and cut off the crust before placing the egg mixture on top. Then I sliced it into two rectangle strips. Reminded me of Tea Time in London.
This recipe was exactly what I was looking for.Great flavor! I used fresh onion instead of dried. Will try fresh dill next time.
Delicious. The dill certainly added a nice flavor to it. Thanks
This recipe is great! I made a vegan version, so I subbed mayo for vegenaise and the egg for drained firm tofu. It was great!

The only change I made: I used minced green onions because I could not find onion "flakes." Is dried minced onion what is meant? Clarify, please. 
Otherwise, my main complaint is that, with the exception of the pepper and mustard, amounts given for seasonings are heavy-handed for my taste. 
The first thing I noticed was saltiness. Now, my salt shaker and I are fast friends, so when I say something's a little on the salty side, it's a considerable problem. Half the amount should do it. Fortunately, it's not inedible once it's spread on bread, but the saltiness is still very noticeable. 
Second, the garlic powder leaves an unpleasantly heavy aftertaste. Again, I like garlic, but somehow a pronounced garlic aftertaste from an egg salad seems a little strange. You will need breath mints. 
Third, the dill is overpowering at the amount listed. I like to taste the eggs in egg salad.
In the end, all I ended up tasting was salt, dill and garlic, pretty much in that order. The eggs seemed to be nothing more than a vehicle, which I find a shame. The delicate taste of egg just couldn't survive the onslaught of seasonings. 
Perhaps the original amounts would work better with fresh garlic and dill. With dried, they're just too much. I would cut each in half, at least. 
I will most likely make this again, because I think it has great potential. But I will not use the original seasoning amounts unless I am able to use fresh ingredients, and I will cut the salt back in any case.

Love It!.. I did cut back the mayo.. add only 3/4 cup, I used fresh onions. put it all in the food processor and let it go..I could not wait for it to chill.. so good! Next time I am going to add black olives and let it chill..
Added paprika and sugar. Substituted onion powder instead of onion flakes, dash of cayenne instead of black pepper. Good egg salad. Pops in bread.
So easy and delicious. Definitely use fresh diced or minced onion instead of dried, and you can cut back the mayonnaise to 2/3 cup. Otherwise excellent as stated.
I followed the recipe as written except 1/2 cup of mayo and we all thought it was to salty. I will leave out the 1/2 tsp. of salt next time.

So easy to make and so good
I love egg salad and this recipe is awesome
very good, I doubled recipe=do not add more mayo=1 cup is enough
Followed exact recipe. Was amazing even two days later!!!!

I made it as written. It was way too salty. Also felt it had too much mayo. I'm giving it 4 stars because if the ingredient amounts are altered to taste it is awesome. I cut the salt, dill and mayo in half, used fresh finely chopped onion instead of the flakes, and sprinkled in some paprika. It's now awesome :)

Used the leftover Easter eggs to make this. The dill gave this salad a truly unique taste that I've never experienced with egg salad before. I thought the proportions were right on. Will definitely make this again.

Awesome...just made this recipe halved with leftover eggs from Easter recipes. Love it and will definitely do this again. Only change was adding approx 1/4 of onion diced instead of onion flakes and substituting onion salt for salf.
Loved this! I saved it and will be making it again, thank you!
Very tasty, however do not add the spices much in advance as it turns the egg salad an unappealing dark color.

A pretty classic recipe that was delicious with mini rye cocktail bread. A tip to make it SUPER quick and easy: use a cookie scoop to portion onto the slices of bread, then simply top with another slice of bread. I used freshly minced onion in place of the onion flakes.
Seriously the BEST egg salad sandwich EVER!!!!! I cut the dill in half, other than that, GREAT! on top of toasted sourdough OMG!
Delicious recipe. Next time I will probably use just little less mayo/salt...but overall I really enjoyed this dish! Thank you!
fantastic! i love this! so did my husband! i didn't change a thing and wouldn't. it's great as it is. thank you!

I gave this 5 stars because honestly it's super easy & yummy. At one time I didn't have the onion flakes, mustard powder, dill weed! And I just didn't add those and added a little bit of curry powder I had and a little more black pepper and amazing! Egg salad is all about what seasonings you'd enjoy rather than the actual recipe.

I was looking for a recipe with dill in it, because I like that tartness dill gives to egg salad, like the kind my mom used to make. This was better than mom's, even my first time around making this salad. I will cut down on the onion flakes next time. I did use 3/4 Miracle Whip and 1/4 Mayo since I prefer a sweeter egg salad. All in all, this was good and it was better than 4 stars but not quite 5, according to my tastes. I will make this again and again.

I make this quite often for my husband but I don't add the dill weed or the onion flakes. The first time I made it with those ingredients he did not like it. Once I cut those 2 items out he said it was much better. He is SO not a picky eater but he liked these so much better without those items.
I didn't have onion flakes on hand so I substituted onion powder. The dill gives it that something extra. Very tasty and I will be making this on a regular basis. Thanks Sara!

2nd best egg salad sandwhich EVER! I(2nd to only my dads which I just like because he made it) I followed other reviews as I added 2T real onions a little less on all the spices than whats called out, 1/2 cup mayo. I suggest you start with 1/2 cup and add as needed, no way to fix too much mayo. I highly suggest adding one stalk of celery. It really was the cherry on top. Will make again.

This egg salad is a decent base, but as written it wasn't quite to my liking. I scaled the recipe for one serving, but kept the proportions right for the ingredients, and all I could taste was mayo and dill. I noted a lot of other reviewers cut the mayo, but I am not a fan of dry sandwich fillings. There was too much mayo even for me! Couldn't taste any of the other seasoning or ingredients, and I even added a diced rib of celery. If it weren't for the nice crunch, I wouldn't have even known it was in there. There was more mayo and dill than egg, so you could hardly say it was egg salad! I think in the future I'll use half the amount of mayo called for (you can always add more if needed, after all), and half the amount of dill, add in an equal amount of paprika as dill (1/8 tsp each for a 2-egg batch), and add the celery again.

Maybe I messed it up (cuz I'm pretty new to this whole cooking thing) and added too much mayo, but it wasn't "eggy" enough, and the dry onion flakes were crunchy, but not in a satisfying way like fresh onions might be. I rate it 3/5 because it's possible that I did something wrong (I know... WHO messes up egg salad???), so maybe it was me!
I really liked this recipe. I will make this again.
Add some paprika and two cans of de-boned sardines and you've got an amazing creation. (You can also add a can of drained sweet corn to top this off)
This was a great and easy recipe for egg salad! Its fairly bland, which was good for my kid. The only spice she didn't love was the dill weed, but I think it added good flavor!
Very good egg salad sandwiches, added chopped celery and made it even better! My husband loves this recipe!
followed to a T...way too salty, otherwise would have been delicious. yikes.
Nice flavor but way too salty. Cut back salt from 1/2 teaspoon to 1/4 teaspoon. I am trying to repair it now. Thank you.
Perfect!!! Cant say enough about the powerful flavor it is the very best egg salad Ive ever ate!
I made this when we had some eggs that needed to be used up before we went on vacation. I really enjoyed it. Next time, I will make it for no reason at all.
Very good! Didn't have onion flakes and put only 1/2 tsp dill.

this was so good...i have never made egg salad but was craving it so i decided to give it a try...this was so easy and tasty!...i did use less mayo, only half a cup and that was plenty so i can't imagine using one cup...also i used dried onion powder and not the amount the recipes called for b/c i was almost out so i just threw in what i had...great and easy recipe!
this was very good
I subed 4oz and 1/2 cup sour cream for mayo. It was great.

The egg salad is delicious! I also used chopped fresh onion instead of flakes and reduced the mayo to 2/3 cup. I still feel this was a bit much and will likely reduce it further next time. I would definitely recommend this with less mayo as it is a quick, easy and yummy dish.

Very good, especially the next day. I omitted the mustard powder since I didn't have any on hand and increased the pepper. I also mixed garlic paste with my mayo before folding into the eggs, but I'm a garlic fiend. I like this on toasted multigrain bread with a side of chips for a quick lunch or snack.
I'm one of those people who like eggs one day and don't like them the next day but this recipe makes me want to make them over and over again! Yummy.
Best egg salad I have ever tasted! I've made it for several group lunches and its always a hit!

great twist on a basic! I used 1/2 cup mayo, and probably 1/4 dijon, 1/4 cup regular mustard since I didn't have dried mustard. Love the garlic powder! I added probably a 1/2 tsp of paprika and a little cayenne since I love it. I only used 1/4 of salt, and it was too salty, so I added another egg. Perfect
Super good! Great recipe for finger sandwiches. I use 12 grain bread, cutting off the edges. Yummy!
Delicious! I'm pregnant and really wanted a good egg salad sandwich and this was perfect!!
Don't skip the dried onion flakes - it's the secret ingredient. Very good!
This was an excellent salad. I had it for lunch yesterday, and my family really enjoyed it.
Excellent tasting egg salad - and I'm not necessarily a lover of egg salad. I really enjoyed the dried onion flakes, mustard and dill in this recipe. My husband has been gobbling it up too. Thanks!!

I followed the advice of many to reduce the mayo to 1/4 cup. I also added 1/2 teaspoon of paprika and instead of the dill weed I added 2 chopped dill pickle spears and one chopped celery stick. It was awesome. My sandwich consisted of toasted bread, lettuce tomato and the egg salad.
I thought this was wonderful! I was used to the kind with pickle relish in it. The dill weed is a great change!

Oh...I'm so sad to give my first bad review on anything. I followed the recipe exactly with a few reviewers' suggestions (including less mayo) and it was SO salty. I absolutely love all of the components of this dish - especially dill - but I thought it had WAY too much of it. I may try it again, but maybe with half the amount of dill.
Excellent exactly as written! The dill just makes a great addition to the eggs.
